results.title: Ashes of time [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tsai Mu-Ho, Scholar Productions and Wong
results.brief_description: ‘Ashes of Time’ is a highly original fantasy, swordplay movie from cult Hong Kong film director Wong Kar-Wai. The film skillfully weaves a handful of stories together through the device of the central character of Ouyang Feng (Leslie Cheung), a mercenary swordsman who owns an inn in the middle of a desert. With his usual flair Wong Kar-Wai (with the help of Australian cinematographer Chris Doyle), creates a visually sumptuous and highly original film. A stylish mix of spaghetti western, epic landscapes and Chinese fantasy folktales and swordfights the film includes a who’s who of Hong Kong film stars. Cast includes Leslie Cheung, Maggie Cheung, Brigitte Lin, Carina Lau, Tony Leung and Jacky Cheung. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Ashes and diamonds = Popiol i diament
results.brief_description: Set on the first day of peace at the end of World War II, this film is a bitter portrait of the ‘lost generation’ of young men who served in the underground resistance (Armii Krajowej) and who cannot reconcile themselves to the post-war communist reality. Maciek (Zbigniew Cybuslki), a young Resistance fighter, is ordered to kill Szczuka (Waclaw Zastrzezynski), a Communist district leader, on the last day of World War II. Though killing has been easy for him in the past, Szczuka was a fellow soldier, and Maciek must decide whether to follow orders. Wajda’s genius is immediately evident from the film’s opening ambush sequence, where Maciek and his compatriot mistake as their target one of two men returning from a labour camp and defines the moral and metaphysical dilemma confronting the Poles as they embrace the struggle to shape their nation’s future. A film of great power, ‘Ashes and diamonds’ is the last of the separate and self-contained stories that make up his war trilogy, preceded in 1954 by ‘A Generation’ and in 1957 by ‘Kanal’. Adapted for the screen by Jerzy Andrzejewski form his novel. In Polish with English sub-titles. Wide Screen Format (letterboxed).

results.title: Ashes and diamonds
results.brief_description: The third part of a massive trilogy dedicated to the youth of Poland in the Second World War. In this extract the action takes place in the late afternoon preceeding the Communist liberation. The hero, Maciek, leads the resistance group, which owes allegiance to the Polish National Government exiled in London. His orders are to assassinate the new Communist District Secretary, Szczuka. Based on the book “Ashes and diamonds” by Jerzy Andrzejewski.

results.title: ASHE: the way of life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Colin Colger
results.brief_description: After the death of his mother and losing his way to a life of crime, Colin, a sports loving Shepparton boy, was offered a new beginning - a lifeline - through ASHE (Academy of Health Sports and Education).

results.title: Ash Wednesday
results.brief_description: Provides a detailed look at the tragedy of the Ash Wednesday bush fires that destroyed a large section of southeastern Australia on 16th February 1983.

results.title: Ash Wednesday
results.brief_description: Documents the restoration of essential electricity supply to fire damaged areas of Victoria after the bushfires of Ash Wednesday, 1983. Shows the work done by the SEC crews and the conditions with which they had to cope.

results.title: Asexual reproduction
results.brief_description: Describes asexual reproduction processes and shows how they differ from those of sexual reproduction. Develops three concepts: that all types of asexual reproduction are basically alike, asexually reproduced offspring are like the parents, and there is no fusion of gametes. Illustrates examples of simple fission in microscopic plants and animals and budding in various plants. No other credits available.

results.title: Asep in action: the teacher (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Contains interviews with teachers on their reactions to A.S.E.P.. They discuss the applicability of A.S.E.P. courses for slow learners through to above average learners. Discusses problems of obtaining the necessary materials and the time required in preparation, followed by demonstrations of the course in classroom situations.

results.title: Asep in action: the student (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows students using the unit “Plants” in the classroom and on an excursion, emphasizing the practical aspects of A.S.E.P. courses, whilst participating in excursions, they discus teacher/student relationships, and their feelings about group work and electives.

results.title: Ascot: a race against time
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide and Wimpey Organization
results.brief_description: The building of the new Queen Elizabeth II Grandstand at Ascot in record time, and an account of the work which was involved. Ten months was the scheduled time allowed for the builders to replace the old Grand Tier - ten months of close co-operation between client, architect, engineer and construction team. Great use of archival footage giving a sense of history and interesting juxtaposition between the models of the new Ascot and its actual construction.
